item.title: Endangered powerful owl among 'sound bath' of bird calls captured by recordings
item.description: Powerful owls prey on possums, and even koalas, but local bird watchers are excited by the discovery of new pairs in South Australia.

item.title: When to share the news of a pregnancy with your employer
item.description: Experts on the rules around when you need to inform your employer if you’re planning to take parental leave.

item.title: Madagascar's president flees country on French plane amid student protests
item.description: Andry Rajoelina flees the country amid widespread protests that saw an elite military unit join demonstrators in opposing the government.

item.title: Australia call up Josh Philippe and Matt Kuhnemann for ODI against India
item.description: Josh Philippe is set to play his first ODI for Australia in four years, after Josh Inglis failed to recover from his calf strain in time for the series opener against India.

item.title: Dave Hughes back in hospital with lung issues six weeks after AFL Legends match
item.description: Comedian Dave Hughes has returned to hospital, six weeks after suffering five broken ribs and a punctured lung in the AFL's Legends game.

item.title: Governments announce full details of $102.5m algal bloom summer plan
item.description: Large scale reef restoration, new real-time water monitoring and a $1 million trial of "AI-powered submersible cytobots" are part of a $102.5 million government algal bloom program to ensure "South Australians can enjoy their summer".

item.title: The Hobart Clinic offered government funding lifeline to stay open for six months
item.description: A southern Tasmanian private mental health clinic will remain open for at least six months after securing $2 million in government funding while it explores a new business model.

item.title: Woman dies in house fire at Bellingen, west of Coffs Harbour
item.description: A 78-year-old woman escapes a blaze on the NSW Mid North Coast, but the body of another woman — believed to be her daughter who lived with disability — is later found inside.

item.title: Mount Buffalo National Park reopens as search for alleged gunman Dezi Freeman continues
item.description: Victoria Police says its search for alleged gunman Dezi Freeman will continue as the Mount Buffalo National Park partially reopens.

item.title: Homicide detectives investigate discovery of man's body in Armidale
item.description: Police are eager to speak to a second man who was taken to hospital, after the body of a man believed to be in his 70s was found at a home on the NSW northern tablelands.

item.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's mobile phone number made available online
item.description: Sussan Ley and other prominent Australians are among those whose details have also been made available on a US-based website.

item.title: Paul Kelly on the songs that inspire him
item.description: As the 70-year-old songwriter prepares his 30th album, he talks about the music that has driven him creatively.

item.title: Former Collingwood coach Nathan Buckley to join Geelong as assistant coach
item.description: Nathan Buckley takes a surprise assistant coaching job as the Collingwood legend awaits on a likely offer to lead Tasmania's inaugural AFL team.

item.title: Australia hosts hottest place on Earth, but here's why it's not a heatwave yet
item.description: Parts of Pilbara and Kimberley surpassed 40 degrees Celsius yesterday but meteorologists say the temperatures will not trigger a heatwave warning yet.

item.title: Noosa mayor says fraudsters used AI imitation in $2.3m council scam
item.description: The mayor of a small council that lost nearly $2 million in a "sophisticated" scam says international fraudsters were able to "imitate personalities" using AI.

item.title: WA Police investigating after man fatally injured in Hocking in Perth's north
item.description: A man is in custody and homicide detectives are investigating following the death of a man in Perth's northern suburbs.

item.title: Fatal plane crash in WA's Midwest likely caused by medical episode, ATSB report reveals
item.description: A report by the Australian Transport Safety Bureau reveals the pilot of a fatal crash in Ogilvie likely suffered an "incapacitating" medical episode.

item.title: Bridget Archer announces funding for Hobart Clinic
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Roblox 'taken to task' but may not be included in social media ban, says eSafety commissioner
item.description: Australia's eSafety commissioner says her team has "taken Roblox to task" over its risk of exposing children to harm but warned the online gaming platform may not be included in the upcoming social media ban.

item.title: 'Appalling history' of abuse at Mount Penang Juvenile Justice Centre
item.description: A former detainee at a notorious Central Coast juvenile justice facility is suing the state of NSW over alleged sexual abuse.

item.title: Suggestion AFLW being used as a 'trial run' for new rules causes frustration
item.description: Collingwood's Tarni White says it feels as though the women's competition is being used as a trial run for new rules before they are implemented into the men's league.

item.title: Inquest continues into death of energy worker mauled by dogs at Logan
item.description: After meter reader Kane Minion was fatally mauled by dogs at a Queensland property, the Coroners Court hears details about the electricity provider's work procedures.

item.title: Victory in Socceroos' friendly against United States could ease World Cup draw
item.description: The Socceroos' friendly against the United States is a positive step in their World Cup preparation, while a positive result could also influence their tournament draw.

item.title: Parts of Coffs Coast Wildlife Sanctuary evacuated due to 'highly venomous' sea snake
item.description: Visitors to a northern New South Wales wildlife sanctuary were forced to evacuate after a woman brought in a rescued sea snake, one of the world's deadliest reptiles.

item.title: As illicit tobacco sales rise into the billions, economist Arthur Laffer puts blame on high tobacco taxation rate
item.description: Internal tobacco industry data estimates the illicit tobacco market now makes up 64 per cent of all tobacco consumed in Australia and 82 per cent of the total nicotine consumed.

item.title: Police officer had 'high likelihood of PTSD' at time of death, inquest told
item.description: A coronial inquest will explore whether the 2022 death of SA Police Senior Constable Benjamin Edward Warren could have been prevented if his mental health issues had been identified.

item.title: Indie film producers tell SXSW Sydney about how to survive and thrive making horror
item.description: Horror films can be a great training ground for filmmakers, but there is also a gritty reality, a panel of indie producers tells SXSW Sydney.

item.title: WA's flu season exceeds 30,000 cases as authorities blame low vaccination rates
item.description: Western Australia records its worst flu season on record, with more than 30,000 influenza cases reported this year.

item.title: Abducted by Hamas, Noa never lost hope she would see her 'soulmate' again
item.description: Noa and Avinatan's abduction from a music festival became an enduring illustration of the horrors endured by Israelis on October 7. Now safely in each other's arms, a chapter has closed on a harrowing two years.

item.title: Concerns teenagers in regional West Australia face further isolation as social media ban looms
item.description: Advocates are concerned rural and remote children will experience compounding challenges with the looming social media ban for people under 16.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Senior conservative James Paterson cautions Liberal Party against splitting
item.description: In a major address to his party, James Paterson says "marginal" voices agitating for the Liberal party to split must be kept on the sidelines, cautioning it would spell "disaster".

item.title: Allegedly armed man who sparked hours-long lockdown of Brisbane City Botanic Gardens in custody
item.description: The Brisbane City Botanic Gardens shuts down for three hours as police respond to reports of a man allegedly wielding a weapon.

item.title: Man once accused of murder of three tourists in Mount Isa in 1978 gives evidence at inquest
item.description: Bruce Preston was once accused of killing three tourists in Mount Isa in 1978, but the prosecution was later dropped.

item.title: Five takeaways from the ABC's Your Say: The Digital Dilemma forum
item.description: An emotional plea to the country, concerns about privacy and how Australia's social media ban will actually work. These are the key takeaways from the ABC's Your Say: The Digital Dilemma forum.

item.title: Bangladesh garment factory fire kills 16, toll may rise, official says
item.description: At least 16 people have died after a fire broke out in a garment factory and a nearby chemical warehouse in Bangladesh.

item.title: Madagascar military says it is seizing power after president flees country
item.description: The country's parliament voted to impeach President Andry Rajoelina after he fled the country in the face of growing opposition from soldiers and police.

item.title: Victorian councils call on state government to strengthen trial aimed at preventing gambling harm
item.description: Victorian councils taking part in a trial of account-based play at pokies venues say they're disappointed with the state government's handling of the scheme.

item.title: An embarrassing backflip by Chalmers on super or a strategic shift?
item.description: After two years of refusing to reshape his superannuation shake-up, the treasurer abandons the idea of taxing unrealised gains while agreeing to index a key tax threshold.

item.title: LNP government criticised over new 'jobs for mates' appointment of party powerbroker
item.description: Queensland's Crisafulli government is embroiled in a new "jobs for mates" claim after it appointed a Liberal National Party powerbroker to oversee the state's lead agency for disaster recovery.

item.title: Why does SA have a summer plan for the algal bloom and what's in it?
item.description: The full details of South Australia's algal bloom summer plan which aims to ensure South Australians can "enjoy their summer" were released yesterday. The plan includes measures to protect the state's coast while supporting businesses and communities.

item.title: Hamas releases more remains of hostages as video of executions in Gaza emerges
item.description: US President Donald Trump warns Hamas it must disarm or be forced to as the militant group hands over the remains of four more hostages to Israel.

item.title: Should Donald Trump be thanked for the Gaza ceasefire and hostage releases?
item.description: Instead of thanking the US president, perhaps people should be asking: why are the hostages only coming home now?

item.title: Illegal fishing is awash in the Timor and Arafura seas. Discarded 'ghost nets' kill wildlife and destroy Australia's pristine coastline
item.description: Illegal fishing is ravaging the world's oceans of fish and shellfish but it is what is left behind that is creating a mess for governments worldwide and of Australia's most remote beaches.

item.title: Why has support for One Nation surged since the federal election, and will it last?
item.description: Polling has support for One Nation somewhere between 10 and 14 per cent, much higher than during the federal election.

item.title: Shadow drone war against European NATO countries blamed by many on Russia
item.description: Peaceful European NATO nations that support Ukraine are repeatedly being targeted by mysterious drone incursions, and experts say dozens in the past month appear to have links to Russia.

item.title: Major study finds tooth decay in Queensland children has declined since water fluoridation expanded
item.description: The findings are released as more Queensland councils opt out of water fluoridation and amid rising rates of misinformation.

item.title: US Supreme Court upholds $2.1b ruling against conspiracy theorist Alex Jones
item.description: The Infowars host claims the 2012 Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting, which claimed the lives of 20 first year students, was a hoax.

item.title: Forensic imaging revealing hidden layers under Sidney Nolan's Ned Kelly paintings
item.description: Hidden figures and inscriptions are being discovered beneath some of Australia's most famous paintings as conservators use infrared technology to reveal details in Sidney Nolan's Ned Kelly series, unseen since the artist's own time.

item.title: Search for missing boy Gus continues ahead of extreme heat in SA outback
item.description: After the second day of a renewed search for Gus in South Australia's outback, police say the search has "concluded with no evidence being located" as they prepare for an early start and high temperatures on Thursday.

item.title: Kangaroos coach Kevin Walters pledges no Queensland bias in Ashes series
item.description: Reece Walsh has built a compelling case for selection in the Kangaroos' starting line-up to face England, but coach Kevin Walters says he will not show favouritism towards the Maroons contingent in his squad.

item.title: Nurse-led clinics allow Riverina GP practices to see more patients
item.description: Nurses working at a medical centre in southern NSW are stepping onto the frontline of patient care to ease the burden on GPs.

item.title: Roosters NRLW second-rower Aliyah Nasio banned for four matches after grand-final brawl
item.description: The NRLW judiciary adds more pain to the Sydney Roosters' grand-final loss to the Brisbane Broncos, with forward Aliyah Nasio banned for four matches.

item.title: Tasmania's fashion industry fears TasTAFE course cuts will impact creative pathways
item.description: Under planned government cuts to vocational training in Tasmania, young aspiring creatives are worried about a loss of opportunity in their home state.

item.title: Grammy-winning R&B singer D'Angelo dies of cancer aged 51
item.description: The Untitled (How Does It Feel) singer died after a long struggle with cancer, his family said.

item.title: Regional developers cash in on the global gaming industry
item.description: Better known for its gas and iron ore, the Pilbara hopes to add gaming to its list of local exports as internet access and technology improve.

item.title: Dying mother loses life insurance after failing to declare UTI tests
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Failure to declare tests after urinary tract infection sees cancer patient's insurance voided
item.description: A terminal cancer patient is told her failure to declare a UTI has voided her insurance policies, leaving her struggling to pay her mortgage and care for her children in her final days.

item.title: Coroner makes rare public statement as NSW records most Indigenous deaths in custody in a year
item.description: NSW Coroner Teresa O'Sullivan's rare public comment on the "entrenched over-representation" of Indigenous prisoners as the state records the most ever in a single year, is welcomed by the grieving family member of a man who died in prison.

item.title: Victorian volunteer firefighter numbers grow despite levy angst
item.description: Despite resentment and anger from some farmers, the CFA says it's well prepared to deal with an elevated fire risk this spring and summer.

item.title: Stuart Broad says Australian cricket team at its 'weakest' ahead of Ashes series against England
item.description: Stuart Broad lights the fuse ahead of the men's Ashes series, saying England has its best chance of winning in Australia since the 2010/11 series.

item.title: Copper Coast Council threatens ratepayer with legal action over 'offensive' comment
item.description: Parking on South Australia's Copper Coast is a hot-button issue with one resident saying he is "prepared to go to court" over comments made about council staff, which have been labelled "offensive" and "threatening".

item.title: Power outage knocks out Victoria's triple-0 dispatch software for several hours
item.description: Victoria's triple-0 dispatch software fails due to a power outage, forcing operators to take notes with pen and paper.

item.title: Prosthetics clients of Jack McDonald question what legal rights they have for compensation
item.description: A prosthetics provider has left Australians thousands of dollars out of pocket, some having to cope with ill-fitting or wrong-coloured fingers and eyes.

item.title: Driver Joash Alec Green jailed for seven years over manslaughter of cousin in Pilbara highway crash
item.description: A Kimberley man is sentenced over the unlawful killing of his cousin in a road crash while attempting to overtake and under the influence of alcohol.

item.title: Herald Sun defends reporting as court battle approaches with Liberal MP Sam Groth
item.description: The Herald Sun newspaper has defended its reporting about deputy leader of the Victorian Liberal Party Sam Groth and his wife as it prepares for a defamation lawsuit in the Federal Court.

item.title: Donald Trump posthumously awards Presidential Medal of Freedom to Charlie Kirk
item.description: The public killing of the conservative figure rocked the US. Now Donald Trump has awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom to Charlie Kirk at a White House ceremony.

item.title: Regional Victorian farmers left high and dry as decent spring rain fails to arrive
item.description: Some Victorian farmers are cutting crops for hay as the drought continues to bite in the nation's south-east.

item.title: Illawarrra Academy of Sport holds open testing day for aspiring young athletes
item.description: Young athletes wanting to be the next Emma McKeon or Jessica Hull have been put through high-performance testing to see if they have what it takes to be a professional.

item.title: Japan makes history as Brazil records 'unacceptable' 3-2 loss in international friendly
item.description: For the first time in 14 meetings, Japan defeats Brazil 3-2 in their international friendly at a sold-out Tokyo Stadium.

item.title: Queensland health minister knew of hospital failures before going on leave
item.description: Queensland's health minister has revealed he knew about failures at Caboolture Hospital involving the death of a patient after delays to medical scan results, before he went on holiday when the issue later became public.

item.title: WA's Coolgardie council avoids suspension, with residents expressing frustration and relief over the saga
item.description: Coolgardie Shire leaders hope to rebuild trust among ratepayers after the local government minister announced the WA state government would not suspend the council.

item.title: Woman, two children, confirmed dead in Gladstone house fire
item.description: Police are still investigating the cause of a fatal house fire in Gladstone this morning.

item.title: England thrashes Latvia 5-0 to qualify for World Cup finals
item.description: Unbeaten in its qualifying matches, England reaches next year's World Cup finals following a dominant 5-0 defeat of Latvia.

item.title: Hundreds of Victorians are graduating as paramedics, but have to go interstate for jobs
item.description: For regional paramedicine graduates, finding a job, let alone one in your hometown, is a challenge.

item.title: Police charge man with murder over death in Hocking in Perth's north
item.description: Police charge a 27-year-old man with murder over the death of a 58-year-old man who suffered significant stab wounds during an altercation at a home in Hocking.

item.title: Alleged South-East Asian scammers targeted by US over huge investment swindle
item.description: A Chinese national accused of being the mastermind behind one of the largest ever investment frauds has been charged in the US.

item.title: Gaps in cyberbullying reporting leave parents feeling lost, struggling to find answers
item.description: Parents and carers are frustrated by what they say is a lack of support when trying to report several Instagram accounts targeting children under the age of 17 over the school holidays.

item.title: Queensland Health issues public health alert as person dies after ingesting rare nitazene
item.description: A second person has died this month after ingesting a synthetic opioid in Queensland, raising concerns about the safety of thousands of teenagers during Schoolies celebrations in coming weeks.

item.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah reveals how the Israel-Gaza war shaped her new book Discipline
item.description: Randa Abdel-Fattah explores the experience of Palestinian Australians in Discipline, her first book for adults.

item.title: Socceroos lose 2-1 to USA in international friendly, ending Tony Popovic's unbeaten start
item.description: The Socceroos suffer defeat for the first time under Tony Popovic, falling to a 2-1 defeat against the USA in Colorado.

item.title: US strike on alleged drug boat off Venezuela kills six, Trump says
item.description: It is the fifth deadly strike in the Caribbean amid the Trump administration's crackdown on alleged drug traffickers.

item.title: Wildlife Photographer of the Year 2025 winners list: Spiders, frogs and fungi
item.description: An Australian photographer who took a unique shot of a skeletoniser caterpillar is among the winners.

item.title: High Court upholds minister's decision to block visa for American commentator Candace Owens
item.description: The High Court has backed a decision by the government to refuse a temporary visa to American commentator Candace Owens Farmer, who had planned a speaking tour to Australia in 2024.

item.title: AFL trade period, deadline day recap: Zach Merrett stuck at Essendon as Charlie Curnow and Christian Petracca find new homes
item.description: The clock runs out on deadline day of the AFL trade period, with Hawthorn failing to seal a deal for Zach Merrett, while the Swans hand over a raft of picks to clinch a move for Charlie Curnow.

item.title: Rockhampton man charged after allegedly stabbing two men at sports club
item.description: Police allege a 21-year-old man stabbed two men at a Rockhampton sports club and threatened another man in unprovoked attacks.

item.title: Search continues for missing bushwalker Daryl Fong in Tasmania's Mount Field National Park
item.description: Tasmania Police Inspector Luke Horne says gale force winds and deep snows are slowing search crews on day three but they still hold out hope.

item.title: Bruce Lehrmann ordered into mediation over funds for lawyers he hired following anti-corruption raids
item.description: The Federal Court orders mediation for former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann over funding he says he was offered to pay for his lawyers.

item.title: Lismore's historical masonic lodge destroyed in early morning fire
item.description: Two men have been charged by police after fire destroyed a historical building in Lismore only recently restored after the devastating 2022 floods.

item.title: The US has dropped out of the top 10 most powerful passports — but where does Australia rank?
item.description: The US passport has fallen to 12th place, a five-spot decline from its previous ranking, tying with Malaysia.

item.title: Police officer drew gun on dog after fatal mauling of meter reader Kane Minion, inquest hears
item.description: The inquest into the death of Kane Minion hears that investigators feared for their safety when visiting the property where the 2022 attack occurred.

item.title: Man sentenced over manslaughter of Darcy Schafer-Turner, found in cabinet in NSW creek
item.description: The court heard Darcy Schafer-Turner was "unconditionally loved by his family" as his school friend was sentenced to six-and-a-half years imprisonment.

item.title: Powerhouse misses opportunity to get Melbourne-bound drums of Sydney's Midnight Oil
item.description: Midnight Oil are Sydney rock royalty, but the drum kit that stuck with the band for more than 40 years is heading to a Melbourne music museum.

item.title: Brian Barnes pleads not guilty to murder of Quambatook woman Merril Kelly
item.description: Brian Barnes, 67, is accused of the murder of Merril Kelly, 70, whose body was found by firefighters after a grassfire near a cemetery in the small Victorian town in January.

item.title: CCC investigation into former Townsville mayor Troy Thompson finished, but unreleased
item.description: A crime and corruption investigation into former Townsville mayor Troy Thompson has been finished, weeks away from a by-election he is expected to contest.

item.title: Mother of 11yo girl says sexual offender Shegu Bobb caused trauma to whole family
item.description: The mother of an 11-year-old girl who was the victim of a Canberra man's sexual offences says his actions have had a lasting impact on her entire family.

item.title: Conjoined boys born in PNG bound for Australia for medical treatment
item.description: The boys, who are only the second known case of conjoined twins born in PNG, are expected to come to Australia for medical treatment.

item.title: Australian seamer Megan Schutt looks to delay retirement until 2026
item.description: Megan Schutt had once planned to walk away after the ODI Women's World Cup, but the veteran seamer is now considering playing into 2026 for Australia.

item.title: ARLC says NRL players face 10-year ban for joining rebel leagues
item.description: The Australian Rugby League Commission has announced a 10-year ban for any NRL player who agrees to join a football competition it does not recognise.

item.title: When is the F1 US Grand Prix, how can I watch and who is battling for the championship?
item.description: Formula 1 returns to the United States, officially marking the final quarter of an epic 2025 championship. Here is what is to come.

item.description: Masked gunmen have carried out "extrajudicial executions" in the streets of Gaza City as an expert claims the terror group is trying to regain control of the destroyed enclave.

item.description: A witness at an inquest into the death of Alice Springs boy Mitchell Thomas has denied doctoring an electrical report in the wake of a fatal house fire.

item.title: Six children charged with murder over alleged stabbing at Shellharbour train station
item.description: A total of six children and an adult have been charged with murder after 25-year-old Jack Westren was allegedly stabbed to death at Shellharbour.

item.description: The Back to the Future star has been candid about life with the degenerative neurological condition.

item.title: How long does it take to acclimatise to a new place when the weather is very different?
item.description: Do our bodies actually acclimatise when moving from one climate to another and can we do anything to smooth the transition?

item.description: Investigators are probing links between a haul of drugs seized on Tuesday and the South-East Asian gang allegedly behind a failed hit in Western Sydney last week.

item.title: SES critical of weather bureau, Eugowra flood inquest told
item.description: The third day of an inquest into two deaths during the 2022 Eugowra flood hears of concerns raised within the SES about the accuracy of weather bureau warnings.

item.title: Federal government puts states, territories on notice over failure to close the gap for Indigenous people
item.description: The federal Indigenous minister may impose penalties on states and territories that fail to meet critical targets for the National Agreement on Closing the Gap.

item.title: Donald Trump says Time magazine cover of himself may be 'worst' in history
item.description: Donald Trump made the comments in reference to Time magazine's upcoming November cover story, detailing how his administration "sealed the Gaza ceasefire deal".

item.title: Australia's baby recession deepens, new ABS data says
item.description: The baby recession in Australia is deepening as cost of living pressures make the decision for people to have children less of a choice.

item.description: A teenager in youth custody over the murders of Dau Akueng and Chol Achiek is forcibly arrested by police after he repeatedly refused to attend court.

item.description: Sean Abbott becomes the latest Test hopeful to suffer an injury, ruled out of NSW's Sheffield Shield match after splitting the webbing on his bowling hand.

item.description: A mother should be held criminally responsible for the death of her 15-year-old daughter, who she allegedly subjected to physical and emotional abuse for a period of five years, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm.

item.description: The man accused of organising the assassination of former Rebels boss Nick Martin believed the bikie had also arranged to have him killed, a Perth court hears.

item.description: British social media star "Big John" says he is being deported from Australia after apparently failing to comply with visa requirements.

item.description: Tasmanian healthcare experts are calling for assurances about the future of a private hospital in Launceston in the wake of a costly infrastructure failure.

item.title: Singapore, 'so dependent on external demand', braces for tariff hit
item.description: Businesses in Singapore — one of the most trade-exposed economies in the world — have been watching the fallout from Donald Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs with apprehension.

item.title: 'No understanding': The extreme cost of living crisis affecting Australia’s most remote communities
item.description: Being one of Australia’s most remote and disadvantaged communities, Aurukun’s grocery prices are some of the highest in the country.

item.title: Historic Number 12 Squadron returns as Australia expands anti-submarine capability
item.description: The federal government has re-established the Number 12 Squadron in SA at the same time as Australia's anti-submarine capability is expanding with the arrival of new aircraft.

item.title: AFL trade period quick hits: Zach Merrett's agent fumes, clubs feud over Callum Ah Chee deal and Charlie Curnow gets his move
item.description: The AFL trade period's deadline day delivered more drama than ever — with a manager blowing up and a Hawks star suggesting Essendon is 'Alcatraz' on a social media post.

item.title: US wants to make rare earth deals with Australia but without China involved, expert says
item.description: As rare earths re-emerge as a central battleground in the US-China trade war, Australian companies are already striking deals to supply America. A policy expert says talks at the White House next week could secure a national agreement.

item.title: Fifty years since the Balibo Five murders, families are still seeking justice
item.description: On the 50th anniversary of the Balibo Five murders, families are still grieving the loss of their loved ones and remain committed to holding those responsible accountable for their actions.

item.title: US vows to 'impose costs on Russia' if Ukraine war continues
item.description: Ukraine implements emergency power cuts across the country amid a relentless drone assault on the country's power grid.

item.title: Australians are no fans of Donald Trump, but see no alternative to US alliance, according to poll
item.description: New polling shows most Australians want to stick with the US alliance, despite holding overwhelmingly negative views towards the Trump administration and harbouring deep worries about the erosion of American democracy.

item.title: Dead koala found after sighting of the endangered animal halted ACT suburb's construction
item.description: The construction of new homes in Canberra's north remains on hold after a koala was spotted. Now, a dead koala has been found nearby.

item.title: What is Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder and how is it diagnosed? Unpacking questions about ADHD
item.description: October marks Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) awareness month and the focus this year is on the many faces of the neurological condition.

item.title: Australians Ajla Tomljanović and James Duckworth reach WTA and ATP quarterfinals in Asia
item.description: Australian duo Ajla Tomljanović and James Duckworth reach the quarterfinals at their respective events in China and Kazakhstan.

item.title: Funeral held for dead Israeli hostage Guy Illouz as two more bodies released
item.description: Funerals begin for dead Israelis returned from Gaza in the ceasefire and hostage exchange deal, as the nation receives the remains of two more former captives.

item.title: Federal politics live: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke speaks at National Press Club
item.description: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke is addressing the National Press Club in Canberra, where he is expected to unveil new powers to crack down on the use of crypto ATMs. Follow live.

item.title: Casterton residents still displaced one year on from 2024 hailstorm
item.description: A year since the freak hailstorm that devastated the Victorian town of Casterton, Kim Jeffrey marked the anniversary the same way she has spent most of 2025 — living in a caravan in her driveway.

item.title: Search for missing 4yo Gus continues in soaring heat
item.description: More than 100 people, including from SA Police, the Australian Defence Force, and the State Emergency Services, have been walking about 20 kilometres per day in hot conditions during the renewed search, police say.

item.title: Bundaberg and Maryborough grapple with anti-social behaviour in town centres
item.description: Arriving at their local park for a morning walk, Lili Jacobsen was pulling her pram out of the car when a woman approached her, talking about the devil and demanding money.

item.title: Nikon Small World photomicroscopy competition's top 15 images of 2025 capture our tiniest signs of life
item.description: Extreme close-ups of rice weevil, pollen in a spider's web and a geometer moth laying eggs are among this year's Nikon Small World competition entries from thousands of scientists and artists across the globe. Here are the judges' favourites.

item.title: Soldier killed in vehicle rollover during army training in north Queensland
item.description: Department of Defence says an Australian soldier has died after a single-vehicle rollover during training at the Australian Army's Townsville Field Training Area.

item.title: High-tech Australian spy plane deployed 45 times during NATO mission to help Ukraine
item.description: Australia's most sophisticated military surveillance plane was deployed 45 times next to Ukraine in the last three months as part of NATO efforts to monitor Russian activity.

item.title: Live market updates: Australian dollar drops, ASX surges as unemployment jump revives rate cut bets
item.description: The Australian dollar falls sharply and the ASX jumps after a steep rise in unemployment revives bets on a November interest rate cut. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

item.title: England saved by rain in Pakistan World Cup match as Australia prepares to face Bangladesh
item.description: Only a rain downpour against Pakistan prevents England from recording its first defeat of the World Cup, as Australia looks to book its berth in knockout stages.

item.title: Cost of 'best practice' on emissions at leaking Darwin gas plant an 'intolerable risk' for Santos
item.description: Santos's Darwin gas plant is set for a new lease of life despite a major methane leak. The company told federal officials the risk it could be forced to meet best practice on carbon emissions was "intolerable".

item.title: Inside the plan to rebuild Juukan Gorge rock shelter destroyed by Rio Tinto
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Replica of destroyed Juukan Gorge being built five years after Rio Tinto blast
item.description: A full-scale replica of the Juukan Gorge rock shelter, destroyed by mining company Rio Tinto, will be built over the remains of the original in Western Australia's north.

item.title: Competitors welcomed to Wollongong for World Triathlon Championship
item.description: Nearly 5,000 athletes from around the globe will converge on Wollongong over the next four days to compete in the World Triathlon Championship Finals.

item.title: $5 milk and $90 rent increases: The NT's rising cost of living pushing families into housing stress
item.description: Kerrie Matthews has been forced to sell personal items to afford life-saving diabetes equipment, and with skyrocketing bills she is putting her house on the market and leaving the Northern Territory.

item.title: Sussan Ley won't put a deadline on net zero review
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Teen girl allegedly fixated with Bondi and Columbine massacres granted bail
item.description: A knife-wielding Victorian teen allegedly fixated by the Columbine school shooting and Bondi Junction attack has been granted bail.

item.title: Prestigious Australian wine labels feeling the pinch as Chinese buy and drink less
item.description: Cheaper bulk wine has been struggling in the market, but now even prestigious labels like Penfolds are feeling the pinch off the back of changing drinking habits and a reported crackdown on lavish banquets for civil servants.

item.title: R360 hits back at Australian Rugby League Commission's threat of 10-year bans for rebel players
item.description: The boss of R360 says threats of 10-year bans for NRL players who defect to the rebel competition are predictable, as the code war escalates.

item.title: Pentagon journalists exit en masse over new reporting restrictions
item.description: Journalists working at the Pentagon had been asked to sign a pledge to refrain from reporting information not authorised for release by the US Department of War.

item.title: Why did Britain's case against two alleged Chinese spies collapse?
item.description: The collapse of the case against the men — a former think-tank director and a researcher for a senior MP — prompts some to argue the British government deliberately failed to provide enough evidence against the pair in order to avoid upsetting China.

item.title: Country GP crushed by vintage tractor in Denmark issues safety warning
item.description: What started as a routine day of chores for a country GP and his son became a life-or-death situation after he was crushed by a vintage tractor.

item.title: Four-time Olympic champion Ariarne Titmus announces retirement
item.description: Ariarne Titmus draws the curtain on a decorated career, in which she won eight medals across two Olympic Games.

item.title: Victorian Auditor-General lays out government's 'slow' and 'burdensome' response to 2022 floods
item.description: A Victorian Auditor-General's report says state government agencies need to be quicker at providing relief and recovery when responding to natural disasters.

item.title: Madura Plains sheep station hits the market as wool and lamb prices soar
item.description: One of Australia's largest sheep stations is listed for sale as wool and lamb prices soar.

item.title: NSW Supreme Court finds protest law amendments invalid after Palestine Action Group challenge
item.description: The Palestine Action Group has won a NSW Supreme Court challenge against a law that limited protests near places of worship.

item.title: Rental affordability report reveals dire reality for essential workers priced out of housing market
item.description: Anglicare has issued a dire warning to policymakers after its latest report found nurses, teachers and paramedics can only afford a tiny fraction of rental properties across the country.

item.title: Abattoir worker's long road to recovery after losing part of leg in meat processor accident
item.description: Almost four years after his leg was partially severed in a workplace accident, Dean Spencer's recovery is ongoing.

item.title: Creative industries warn against big tech theft of Australian art
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Which team came out the most ahead in the AFL draft period and does free agency need fixing?
item.description: It was one of the more chaotic AFL trade periods on record as picks and players moved all over the place — but who came out ahead the most?

item.title: Faulty engineering led to Titan submersible implosion
item.description: A report has found the owner failed to adequately test the Titan submersible and was unaware of its true durability before it imploded in 2023, killing five people.

item.title: Police investigating reports of explicit deepfake images of girls from Sydney school
item.description: The ABC understands a number of families attended Eastwood Police Station on Wednesday evening after growing frustrated that a local high school had failed to act on a complaint.

item.title: Broken Hill man who ran 27 marathons in 29 days finishes with fractured hip
item.description: Mitch McKenny is unlikely to run again after spending four weeks running from Broken Hill to Newcastle, including the last 380 kilometres with severe pain in his hip.

item.title: Gerard Maley airs criticism in parliament
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Calls for federal oversight of Indigenous deaths in custody rejected in the NT
item.description: Three decades after the landmark Royal Commission into Aboriginal Deaths in Custody, the Northern Territory parliament rejects a motion proposing the federal government establish an independent oversight body.

item.title: Australia's unemployment rate jumps to 4.5pc
item.description: Australia's unemployment rate jumped to 4.5 per cent in September, up from 4.3 per cent in August.

item.title: Kingston residents rally to save 130yo oak tree from transmission project
item.description: Residents are getting creative in their fight to save a "magnificent" 130-year-old Algerian oak tree from being felled for a controversial transmission line project in western Victoria.

item.title: Canberra pharmacists will be able to offer more treatments, vaccinations from 2026
item.description: Pharmacists in the ACT will be able to offer more treatment options to patients, under changes set to take effect from early 2026.

item.title: Public wi-fi a major cause of hacking and cyber crime, consumer affairs authorities warn
item.description: A Perth man has described how having his all his electronic devices hacked has up-ended his life and left him feeling like "someone has walked into my bedroom with a knife".

item.title: Female shearer sets world record by shearing 500 merino lambs in one day
item.description: Nikki Lyons's clippers started humming at 6am. Twelve hours later, she was a world record holder.

item.title: Matt and Kate built an earthship house with recycled bottles and the help of strangers
item.description: Kate and Matt knew they had to do things differently if they ever wanted to live in their dream home. Not only did they swap the city for regional Tasmania and build a house using recycled bottles — they also relied on volunteers.

item.title: Homicide squad arrives in Gladstone after triple fatal house fire
item.description: A woman and two boys died in a blaze on Wednesday. The house collapsed, hampering search efforts by emergency services.

item.title: Remains of missing Victorian woman Lucinda Miller discovered in police search
item.description: Police have uncovered human remains in bushland in Victoria's east believed to be missing woman Lucinda Miller.

item.title: Former US Marine Pilot Dan Duggan appears in person at appeal against extradition
item.description: US authorities want Dan Duggan extradited from Australia for allegedly training Chinese pilots in South Africa in 2012. An appeal to avoid the extradition has started in the Federal Court today.

item.title: Ariarne Titmus's retirement ends years of sacrifice and allows her to at last savour her greatness
item.description: Ariarne Titmus has given her life to a dream. As she sets off on her next adventures, she can be in no doubt that her years of sacrifice and devotion were worth it.

item.title: Consumer groups, regulator concern as number of Australians accessing super to fix health surges again
item.description: Australians withdrew more than $1.4 billion from their superannuation on compassionate grounds last year, in another jump from previous years.

item.title: Ariarne Titmus labelled a 'living legend' after calling time on decorated swimming career
item.description: Olympic teammates and rivals pay tribute to the career of Australian swimming great Ariarne Titmus, who has announced her retirement at the age of 25.

item.title: First Nations artists warn against AI 'double colonisation' as Meta uses work for training
item.description: The rapid development of AI is testing the effectiveness of the Copyright Act, with creative and media industries calling for better protections.

item.title: Air crash investigators don't know why a light plane crashed near Canberra in 2023 killing four people
item.description: The Australian Transport Safety Bureau says the aircraft likely experienced icing, but it is unsure why the pilot did not attempt recovery actions.

item.title: Trump confirms the CIA is conducting covert operations inside Venezuela
item.description: Donald Trump says he authorised the CIA operation in part to stop the flow of "drugs coming in from Venezuela".

item.title: Influencer issues warning after stranger memorises phone number at check-out
item.description: A South Australian influencer has used her TikTok to warn others to be careful about sharing personal information in public, after a stranger memorised her phone number while she recited it to a cashier.
